intro: Euphrasia fennica subsp. aestivalis, commonly known as the early marsh eyebright, is a flowering plant native to northern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate yellow flowers with dark markings. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It produces small, oval leaves that are covered in fine hairs. This subspecies is often found in open, sunny areas and is noted for its early blooming period in the spring.
